channel.title: Google chrome is out!
channel.description:
http://www.google.com/chrome
The ui is a little strange and it'll take sometime to get used to but, its clearly the fastest browser out. After a year or so i can really see this gaining on firefox, just needs plugin and theme support and it'll be done.
http://www.google.com/googlebooks/chrome/
This is what originally excited me about the browser, just read about how it works.

item.title: Google chrome is out!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Thug-life:

I bet bowserjr2 uses windows, microsoft have come out many times and said they do monitor what people do on the internet and such, their excuse last was “But we’re not the only ones”.

Yes I use Windows and GNU/Linux, but not so bad that Microsoft do that, than Google do it.
The reason is, I never use live search, they are not so big than google in ads, but I don’t like it, and their break the law when they do it.

R.I.P RSC:

Even if they do monitor anything, who cares. There are millions of people that use it, they really don’t look through everything to see if there’s anything interesting.

Google saves everythings you search on and use it to give you ads.
And they store the data illegal long.

Read full topic

item.title: Google chrome is out!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Thug-life:

I bet bowserjr2 uses windows, have come out many times and said they do monitor what people do on the internet and such, their excuse last was “But we’re not the only ones”.

Monitoring is not the same as scamming/adding spyware. And of course other companies record usage of their software (to the user’s option, of course). They need to monitor their software to ensure it is working properly. They don’t record passwords, cookies, or anything like that. They record websites mapped to your IP address, that’s it.

Read full topic

item.title: Google chrome is out!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:96, topic:229424”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=301812.msg2424260#msg2424260 date=1220494246]
http://tapthehive.s483.sureserver.com/chrome.html

Tbh, it was a misunderstanding. Google doesn’t do monitoring and doesn’t steal work.

Also, both bugs are obviously known to Google Chrome developers and are probably going to be fixed by tomorrow. I don’t know about you guys, but I’m using Chrome right now and I think it’s pretty good. Sure, I’d like a little less CPU usage on the main application, but it’s still alright.
[/quote]
Ok they don’t monitoring now, but if they later want so they have your permission.
And if I have readed ToC rigth the will be automatic downloads of software updates, that can add Google “spyware” to your Google Chrome install.[/quote]

You are just being paranoid tbh. Google wouldn’t be the largest company in the world at what they do if they scammed people who used their software.

[quote=“the bank, post:104, topic:229424”][quote author=io9 link=topic=301812.msg2424911#msg2424911 date=1220557532]
Not really, the mem manager is for the the program, not it’s updater. It’s separate.
[/quote]Not really…Mozilla’s is built in. So, it’s kind of giving chrome the memory advantage considering they are not taking away the memory used by firefox’s.

Regardless, they are both good browsers. As long as people don’t use IE.[/quote]

Sure, firefox is pretty good, but so is Opera and Safari. Chromium is in its own league. Google chrome has so many benefits compared to other browsers. Firstly, it provides powerful asynchronous loading when going to a web page (hence why it is the fastest browser), it also wraps a sandbox around all javascript functions (for security), every tab is a different application (which is also supposed to be a security enhancement), it has a virtual machine built-in just for javascript, and much more. All that I listed above hasn’t been done before, but Google also does what other browsers do- open source (for additions and perhaps multiple LAF support), spellchecker, good favorites organizing (better than other sites), etc. The list goes on and on. This browser is the supreme tbh.

And, if you’re a real geek, read through this book-like overview of Chromium:

http://books.google.com/books?id=8UsqHohwwVYC&printsec=frontcover&dq=google+chrome

Read full topic

item.title: Google chrome is out!
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Yes because something which queries a server checking if it’s the most recent version will really add tremendous amounts of CPU time and take up a shit of memory

Seriously, people are fucking morons. Google brought this out so people could take a look at the framework, it’s fucking version 0.2. If you expect a fully functioning browser then you’re a complete fuckwit and desserve to be shot.

I’ve already seen blog posts stating “10 latest bugs found in Chrome” and slanting the shit out of it because of that. IE has been out for years and it’s still complete wank and full of bugs. If you find exploits and bugs report them so they get fixed.

I’ve also seen people moaning about the terms of use. It’s called covering your ass, everyday people try to sue companies like google and microsoft because it’s so easy to make a fortune.

The only issue I’ve had with chrome is they’re recording peoples IPs along with they enter in the omnibar, but haven’t yet stated what this is being used for. However, they do have the option to disable it, and if you’re intelligent you can probably check out the source code and remove anything you dislike.

Read full topic
